meanings.definition: A partial refund to someone who has paid too much money for tax, rent, or a utility.
meanings.sent1: I received a rebate for overpaying my electricity bill last month.
meanings.sent2: The store offered a rebate on the new washing machine, making it more affordable.
meanings.sent3: Getting a rebate on my parking ticket felt like winning a small prize.
meanings.sent4: The rebate was a lifesaver, helping me balance my budget for the month.
meanings.sent5: The rebate check arrived just in time to cover unexpected expenses.

meanings.definition: A discount or deduction from the full amount of a price or debt.
meanings.sent1: She used a rebate coupon to get a discount on her new laptop.
meanings.sent2: The company offered a rebate for early payment of the invoice.
meanings.sent3: Finding a rebate for the movie tickets made their date night even better.
meanings.sent4: The rebate felt like a little victory in the battle against high prices.
meanings.sent5: The rebate was the perfect solution to afford the expensive repair.
